paper_abstract: A language L is called the orthogonal shuffle of the language L(1) with the language L(2), along the trajectory set T if every word in L is uniquely obtained as the shuffle between a word in L(1), a word in L(2) along a trajectory word in T. In this paper we investigate properties of the orthogonal shuffle on trajectories, as well as several types of language equations using this language operation. As a corollary, we obtain several properties of orthogonal catenation, orthogonal literal shuffle and orthogonal insertion.
